Paches, son of Epicurus; Surrounded by phroura; Athens Attacking

Diodoros mentions the garrison at 12.49.2 (428 BC). This passage summarises Thucydides 2.93 where, however, the Athenian garrison on Salamis on a cape facing Megara remains unnamed. At 3.51.2 Thucydides mentions the same garrison and this time names it. Using Salamis here. Spartans seem to have given up the fort after a day.
